intro: Centaurium fastigiatum, commonly known as the upright centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with hairy surfaces, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Centaurium fastigiatum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
